definition: to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support

sentences.english: I don't think you wanna go on.
sentences.chinese: 估计你也不想再硬撑下去了。

sentences.english: The staff should have taken a rest at home when he was sick. No need drag himself to work.
sentences.chinese: 员工生病了就应该在家休息，不必硬撑着去上班。

sentences.english: There are some companies, although still" alive ", but also relinquish its hard-bound .
sentences.chinese: 还有一些企业，虽然还“活着”，但也是在硬撑。

sentences.english: Way on the face very hard time, but also hard support.
sentences.chinese: 路子面子上很过不去，却还硬撑着。

sentences.english: Don't confront the situation if you don't feel you can keep your cool.
sentences.chinese: 在无法保持冷静的情况下不要硬撑场面。

definition: to use all one's willpower (to do sth)/to hang in there
to show off/to try to be brave
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
to endure with all one's will/to hold out/rigid/stiff
to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
to comfort oneself/to console oneself/to reassure oneself
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
to stand firm/to stand one's ground (in the face of adversity or pain)
to collapse/to be worn out/to break down
see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]
to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
